adjectives.description: osculatory (comparative more osculatory, superlative most osculatory)

entries.meaning: (geometry) Relating to, or having the properties of, an osculatrix; capable of osculation.
examples: A circle may be osculatory with a curve, at a given point.

entries.meaning: (Christianity) A religious tablet, usually carrying a representation of Christ or the Virgin Mary, which is kissed by the priest during the Mass ("kiss of peace"); it is then passed to others at the mass who also kiss it.
